court: IN IN IN THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY

IN IN IN THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY

IN IN IN INSOLVENCY INSOLVENCY INSOLVENCY

REPORT REPORT REPORT NO. 162 OF 2006 NO. 162 OF 2006 NO. 162 OF 2006

IN IN IN

INSOLVENCY INSOLVENCY INSOLVENCY NO. 103 OF 1968 NO. 103 OF 1968 NO. 103 OF 1968

Re.: Bachubhai Jamanadas (Personal). ... Insolvent.

Ex-parte :

M/s. Krishnaji Bharmaty

& Co.

... Petitioning Creditors.

.....

Mr. G.G. Ketkar, 1st Asstt. to Official Assignee.

.....

CORAM CORAM CORAM : DR. D.Y. CHANDRACHUD,J. : DR. D.Y. CHANDRACHUD,J. : DR. D.Y. CHANDRACHUD,J.

ND ND ND DECEMBER, 2006. DECEMBER, 2006. DECEMBER, 2006.

P.C. P.C. P.C. : : :

.

An order of adjudication was passed on 7th January

.

A

pro-rata preferential dividend of Rs.0.100

ps.

in

a rupee was declared on rd July .

Thereafter, an

amount

of

Rs.52,839.73

ps.

due to

three

preferential

Creditors

was

transferred

to

the

Unclaimed

Dividend

Capital

Account

on th January .

At

present,

the

aggregate assets in the hands of the Official Assignee are

Rs.28,509.67

ps.

as

against

the

Proved

Preferential

Liability of Rs.52,839.73 ps. The prayers of the Official

Assignee are to the following effect :-

(a)

The Official Assignee may be

permitted to declare dividend on Proved

Unsecured Liability of Rs.110/-;

(b)

The Official Assignee may be

permitted

to

pay interest

Under

Section

(6)

of

the Presidency

Town

Insolvency

:2:

Act, 1909, to the Preferential and

Unsecured Creditors;

(c)

That the Official Assignee may be

permitted

to

treat

this

Insolvency

as

Annulled U/s. 21(1) of the Presidency Town

Insolvency Act, 1909;

(d)

After paying interest as prayed

hereinabove, balance may be permitted to be

refunded to the Insolvent and account may

be closed for administrative purpose.

.

The Report is made absolute in terms of prayer

clauses (a) to (d).
